name: Mediterranean Black Olive Bread
author: MARBALET
summary: You can vary the flavor of this bread with your choice of olive - Kalamata, Amfisa, Arbequina, Niscoise ... ... ....
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: In a large bowl, mix together flour, yeast, sugar, salt, black olives, olive oil, and water
Turn out dough onto a floured board
Knead until smooth and elastic, 5 to 10 minutes
Set aside, and let rise about 45 minutes, until it doubles in size
Knead well again, for about 5 to 10 minutes
Let rise for about 30 minutes, until it doubles in size
Round the dough on kneading board
Place upside down in a bowl lined with a lint-free, well floured towel
Let rise until double in size
While the bread is rising for the third time, put a pan of water in the bottom of the oven
Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Gently turn loaf out onto a sheet pan that has been lightly oiled and dusted with cornmeal
Bake loaf at 500 degrees F (260 degrees C) for 15 minutes
Reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Bake for 30 more minutes, or until done
